crm:permset:assign.description: Assign a permset to one or more users
examples:
$ sfdx crm:permset:assign
          -u myalias
          --permsetlabel="Dreamhouse"
          --filter="Profile.Name = 'Lightning Sales'
$ sfdx crm:permset:assign
          -u myalias
          --permsetlabel="Dreamhouse"
          --o='myuser@testorg.com'

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

permsetlabel.name: permsetlabel
permsetlabel.description: A single Permission Set. Use Label of the Perm set

onbehalfof.name: onbehalfof
onbehalfof.description: Comma-separated list of usernames. if --filter is also specified, this flag is combined in the where clause with an OR

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
Analogous to SOQL where clause to pull usernames from Standard User Object. Any queryable field in User Obect can be used.
Examples:

"Profile.Name LIKE 'System Admin%' AND Department = 'IT'

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Output to screen in csv format, defaults to false unless --checkonly flag is set

checkonly.name: checkonly
checkonly.description: Just display details, no updates are made, defaults to false.

crm:profile:fieldpermissions:set.description: Sets Field Level Security of fields for a list of profiles.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

profiles.name: profiles
profiles.description: List of profiles separated by commas. You can also use wildcards as part of this parameter to match on profile names (only ^,$,* are supported, ^ matches start of the profile name, $ matches end of the profile name and * matches one or more characters anywhere in a profile name).

sobjects.name: sobjects
sobjects.description: List of SObjects separated by commas.

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
Analogous to SOQL where clause to pull fields from SObjects. Allowed fields: CreatedDate, CreatedBy, LastModifiedDate, LastModifiedBy and DeveloperName. DeveloperName here referes to the SObject custom field.

Examples:

LastModifiedBy.LastName='Doe' AND lastModifiedDate = TODAY AND DeveloperName like 'MyCustom%'

readaccess.name: readaccess
readaccess.description: read permission, defaults to 'true'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

editaccess.name: editaccess
editaccess.description: edit permission, defaults to 'true'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Output to screen in csv format, defaults to false unless --checkonly flag is set

checkonly.name: checkonly
checkonly.description: Just display details, no updates are made to profiles, defaults to false.

crm:profile:objectpermissions:set.description: Sets SObject Level Security for a list of profiles.

loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

profiles.name: profiles
profiles.description: List of profiles separated by commas. You can also use wildcards as part of this parameter to match on profile names (only ^,$,* are supported, ^ matches start of the profile name, $ matches end of the profile name and * matches one or more characters anywhere in a profile name).

sobjects.name: sobjects
sobjects.description: List of SObjects separated by commas.

readaccess.name: readaccess
readaccess.description: Read SObject permission, defaults to 'true'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

createaccess.name: createaccess
createaccess.description: Create SObject permission, defaults to 'true'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

editaccess.name: editaccess
editaccess.description: Edit SObject permission, defaults to 'true'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

deleteaccess.name: deleteaccess
deleteaccess.description: Delete SObject permission, defaults to 'false'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

viewallaccess.name: viewallaccess
viewallaccess.description: View All SObject permission, defaults to 'true'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

modifyallaccess.name: modifyallaccess
modifyallaccess.description: Modify All SObject permission, defaults to 'false'. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Output to screen in csv format, defaults to false unless --checkonly flag is set

checkonly.name: checkonly
checkonly.description: Just display details, no updates are made to profiles, defaults to false.

crm:profile:recordtypevisibilities:set.description: Sets Record Type Visibilities for a list of profiles.

targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion

profiles.name: profiles
profiles.description: List of profiles separated by commas. You can also use wildcards as part of this parameter to match on profile names (only ^,$,* are supported, ^ matches start of the profile name, $ matches end of the profile name and * matches one or more characters anywhere in a profile name).

recordtypes.name: recordtypes
recordtypes.description: JSON Array of Record Type visibility details. Example: [{"name":"CustomObj__c.DevelperName_of_RecordType1", "default":true", "visible":true}, {"name":"CustomObj__c.DeveloperName_of_RecordType2", "visible":false},...]

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Output to screen in csv format, defaults to false unless --checkonly flag is set

checkonly.name: checkonly
checkonly.description: Just display details, no updates are made to profiles, defaults to false.
